Desc.entry: A registered charity that identifies and develops facilities and addresses African women's and refugee/asylum seekers' health related issues and needs. Ensures that services are accessible to the needs of African women and refugee/asylum seekers. Offers a women's drop-in for advice and advocacy about health and other issues. Also provides training and education in partnership with the WEA (Workers Education Association).

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Mon 9.30-11.30am (beginners English for women), Tues 10am-12noon (Arabic for women), Wed 9.30-11.30am (advanced English for women), Thurs 10am-12noon (cooking on a budget for women), Fri 9.30-11.30 (advanced English for women), Sat 10am-12noon (homework club for boys and girls)

category.entry: BLACK AND MINORITY ETHNIC PEOPLE - GENERAL SUPPORT ORGANISATIONS
